```{r}
library(lfe)
library(jtools)
library(stargazer)
```



```{r}
df <- read.csv("data_output/data_model_Chile_2021.csv")
df
```


Model
```{r}

data <- df
model_1 <- felm(growth ~ divisiveness | factor(candidate), data = data)
model_2 <- felm(growth ~ rate_x | factor(candidate), data = data)
model_3 <- felm(growth ~ entropy | factor(candidate), data = data)
model_4 <- felm(growth ~ log(voters) | factor(candidate), data = data)

model_5 <- felm(growth ~ divisiveness + rate_x + log(voters) + entropy | factor(candidate), data = data)

stargazer(model_1, model_2, model_3, model_4, model_5, type = "text")
```
```{r}
data <- df
model_1 <- felm(scale(growth) ~ scale(divisiveness) | candidate + commune, data = data)
model_2 <- felm(scale(growth) ~ scale(rate_x) | candidate + commune, data = data)
model_3 <- felm(scale(growth) ~ scale(hhi) | candidate, data = data)
model_4 <- felm(scale(growth) ~ scale(voters) | candidate, data = data)
# model_5 <- felm(scale(growth) ~ scale(poverty_rate) | candidate, data = data)

model_6 <- felm(scale(growth) ~ scale(divisiveness) + scale(rate_x) + scale(voters) + scale(hhi) | candidate + commune, data = data)
# + scale(poverty_rate) model_5
stargazer(model_1, model_2, model_3, model_4, model_6, type = "text")
```

```{r}
cor(data[, c("hhi", "entropy", "voters", "rate_x", "divisiveness")],  method = "pearson")
```


```{r}
plot_summs(model_5, plot.distributions = TRUE, inner_ci_level = .95)
```

```{r}
res <- resid(model_5)
#create Q-Q plot for residuals
qqnorm(res)

#add a straight diagonal line to the plot
qqline(res) 

plot(density(res))

```
